content:
First, I don't have a solution on why Thunderbird disappeared. So, my suggestion is to check your Windows account. You mentioned being the 'second user' and my thought is that you are logging into PC with your son's account and not yours. Managing multiple setups on Windows I have never done, but that seems a possibility.

Question: Is Thunderbird now working with a new profile? Please give status on your situation.
creator: davidsk

content: We hope all goes well. I am not very technical on the internals, but if yours is a very old computer, it may be 32-bit and you may be attempting to install 64-bit version. But that's just a wild guess...

content: My first suggestion is to review the settings carefully on the phone, as it may be that your PC is not setup the same way. The 'not connecting' message indicates that the server name or port number may be wrong.
creator: davidsk

content: FIRST, please STOP creating new posts for every response. Keep this message in your inbox and reply with it. That will keep the messages together. Since you made no changes, my guess is that Norton antivirus may be interfering. There are settings in Norton that let it not interfere with email settings. Since you have posted this problem in the past, this could be a part of that. I do not know what you mean by a Google antivirus, but two antivirus programs is one too many. Desirable screenshots (which may not be needed if the antivirus is the cause) are - click account settings, then server settings. That screenshot would show info on incoming server - click account settings, scroll down left side to 'Outgoing Server (SMTP) and click your outgoing server. That screenshot will provide info on how you are set up for sending.
creator: davidsk

content: I don't think there's a way to only open the calendar, but if you want to start without connecting to mail servers, launch in offline mode (Settings/General/Network & Disk Space, Offline...). This will also prevent network calendars and address books from connecting at startup.
creator: sfhowes

content: I discovered the problem: I usually prefer to look at the "All mail" view of Gmail on my phone. This (evidently) doesn't properly reflect the deleted status from Thunderbird (and perhaps from Gmail as well).
creator: spartanhooah

content: Most users unsubscribe All Mail (see All Mail). On my setup, when a message is deleted, with 'just mark as deleted', it's shown with a strikethrough, and is made invisible at the next folder sync. As mentioned in the kb article, if a message is in multiple folders, deleting it by just marking, does not delete it from the other folders. This is a gmail-only property.
creator: sfhowes

content: That is because trash and deleted are part of all mail. I generally recommend not using it as it increases the disk space and causes extra overhead for Thunderbird to update. Your reported problem also happens if you have not specified to Gmail to expunge when marking as deleted.
creator: davidsk

content: You might try creating a csv file. In addressbook, highlight the addressbook. Click the three dots to the right and select the export option .

content:
If you just want the addressbook, it can be retrieved by - clicking help>troubleshootinginformation - scroll down to 'profile folder' - click 'open folder' - exit TB - highlight abook.sqlite and copy to the flashdrive

- on mac, assuming menus are alike, click tools>import>import from a file and follow the options to the menu to import an sqlite file.
creator: davidsk

content: I tried both but I do not find the abook.sqlite folder and when I did the import it took me to set 4 and the desktop opened up but it would not let me save it or do anything. At the bottom was options and *.sqlite showed up but I could not do anything with it. Also I am behind the times as I am still running High Sierra since I use an older version of Quicken that I love using instead of the new version that to me is junk!!
creator: Mac73

content: abook.sqlite is a file, not a folder, and should appear in the profile folder. If your thunderbird is several years old, it may appear as abook.mab. Same import applies, as there is a menu for the mab suffix.
creator: davidsk
